Constructor Detail

CollapsibleNode

public CollapsibleNode()
Method Detail

makeCollapsible

public static CollapsibleNode makeCollapsible(Node in)
This method will take the given node, and replace it with a CollapsibleNode. It will detach the given Node's parent and children and give these to the returned CollapsibleNode. The CollapsibleNode will also assume the given Node's Object and Component. After calling this, the given Node will be empty (no parent, children, component or object).

Parameters:
in - the Node to replace
Returns:
the generated CollapsibleNode

isCollapsed

public boolean isCollapsed()
Is this node collapsed? That is, does this node fold its children?

Returns:
true if the node is collapsed, false otherwise

isHiddenByCollapse

public boolean isHiddenByCollapse()
Is this node hidden by a collapse by its parent? This does not check whether the node is hidden by collapse through any parent other than its own.

Returns:
true if the node is hidden by collapse, false if it is hidden by itself or not hidden

collapse

public void collapse()
Collapse this node by hiding its children. This will cause any non-hidden children to hide, and any children that are added in the future will be hidden as well. When "show()" is called on a child, it will remain hidden until "expand()" is called.

expand

public void expand()
Expand, aka uncollapse Take the children of this node that were no longer visible by collapse and show them again.

show

public void show()
Show this node. This method has the same effect as with the regular Node class, with the exception that it takes collapsed parents into account. If the parent is collapsed, this method will not show the Node directly, however, it does mark the node to be shown when the parent expands or when this node is removed from its parent.

Overrides:
show in class Node
See Also:
Node.show()

hide

public void hide()
Hide this node. This method has the same effect as with the regular Node class, with the exception that it takes collapsed parents into account. If the Node is hidden while its parent is collapsed, the Node will be marked, so that expanding the parent

Overrides:
hide in class Node
See Also:
Node.hide()

Description copied from class: Node
Add a node as child. This throws a RuntimeException if the given child already has a parent

removeChild

public Node removeChild(int index)
Description copied from class: Node
Remove (separate) the child at the given index from its parent. Note that this will also remove the associated Edge object.

Overrides:
removeChild in class Node
Parameters:
index - the index of the child to separate
Returns:
the separated child
